input_text:
Job Title: Chemical Process Engineer

Location: The Woodlands, TX

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Dear AspirantsCurrently, we are looking for talented resources for one of our listed clients. If interested please reply to me with your updated resume or feel free to reach out to me for more details at (949) 535-1646.
Title: Process Engineer Location: The Woodlands, TX (Hybrid Position)Duration: Full-Time
Job Overview:Our Client is looking for an experienced Process Engineer for our office in The Woodlands, TX.We are open to candidates who are able to work remotely from our offices in Allentown, PA, or Orem, UT.We are also open to a hybrid schedule for this role. The successful candidate will begin to take direct engineering responsibility for the conceptual design of Our Client process technologies to meet customer requirements. This individual must work well within a small team environment while preparing process information deliverables for the basic engineering design package.What Your Day-to-Day Activities Will Be:Perform process simulations for heat and material balancesPrepare process equipment data sheets and equipment listsPrepare Process Flow DiagramsAssist in the development of Piping and Instrumentation DiagramsPerform process systems calculations, including line sizing, hydraulic evaluations, and relief valve sizingWrite process descriptionsProvide process data to the Instrument, Controls, and Electrical Department for the preparation of instrument data sheetsCheck process engineering work performed by other Process and Junior Process EngineersAssist in the preparation of Start-up and Operating ManualsParticipate in unit start-upsYour Education Should Be:Bachelor’s in Chemical Engineering3 to 15 years of recent, hands-on process engineering experiencePreferably, an EIT certificate with plans to obtain a PE License Working knowledge of Microsoft OfficeYour Professional Experience Should Be:Recent startup and commissioning efforts in a gas plant environmentKnowledge of chemical engineering “First Principles”Working knowledge of ASPEN, HYSYS, and/or SimSci process simulation softwareKnowledge of cryogenic process technologies which can include cryogenic air separation, natural gas liquefaction, hydrogen liquefaction, helium processing and liquefaction, etc.Knowledgeable in natural gas processing technologiesUnderstand basic applicable engineering codesProven teamwork, interpersonal, and organization skillsStrong communication skills both verbal and written for the purpose of explaining challenges and solutions internallyAbility to interface with other engineering disciplines and with customers

Experience Level (if available): None

output_json.title: Chemical Process Engineer
job_responsibilities: Perform process simulations for heat and material balances
Prepare process equipment data sheets and equipment lists
Assist in the development of Piping and Instrumentation Diagrams
Provide process data to the Instrument, Controls, and Electrical Department
Assist in the preparation of Start-up and Operating Manuals
